==Dutch== ===Etymology=== Borrowing from {{der|nl|en|hint}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|nl|Nl-hinten.ogg|Audio}} ===Verb=== {{nl-verb}} # to [[hint]] ====Inflection==== {{nl-conj-wk|hint}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|nl|hint}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|hintana}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhɪntən/|[ˈhɪntən]|[ˈhɪntn̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-hinten.ogg|Audio}} ===Adverb=== {{head|de|adverbs}} # [[behind]]; in the [[back]] #: ''Das Kind sitzt '''hinten''' im Auto.'' #:: The child is sitting '''in the back''' of the car. # {{lb|de|chiefly|colloquial}} [[over]] ([[there]]); [[yonder]] {{gloss|unspecified locative for something at some distance}} #: ''Du kannst doch '''hinten''' beim Kreisverkehr wenden.'' #:: Why don’t you turn around '''over''' at the traffic circle. ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|yonder}} {{l|de|drüben}}, {{l|de|dahinten}} ===Derived terms=== * {{l|de|Vokuhila}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
